content.text:
# James McKeen Cattell Fellow Award

The James McKeen Cattell Fellow Award is an award of the Association for Psychological Science given since 1992. The award is named after James McKeen Cattell and "honors  individuals for their lifetime of significant intellectual contributions to the basic science of psychology." As part of APS's 25th Anniversary, the APS Board of Directors recognized a larger class of James McKeen Cattell Fellows in 2013, identifying them as individuals who have had a profound impact on the field of psychological science over the previous quarter century.‚Äù
